title: Glen Fitzpatrick
text:
Glen Fitzpatrick (born 26 January 1981 in <a href="Dublin">Dublin</a>) is an Irish former <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who is the current Director of Football at Broadford Rovers in the <a href="Leinster%20Senior%20League%20%28association%20football%29">Leinster Senior League (association football)</a>.
A former youth international he made his <a href="League%20of%20Ireland">League of Ireland</a> debut for UCD against <a href="Shamrock%20Rovers">Shamrock Rovers</a> on 16 October 1998.
Before he joined Pats he played for Broadford Rovers, <a href="Cherry%20Orchard%20F.C.">Cherry Orchard</a>, <a href="University%20College%20Dublin%20A.F.C.">UCD</a>, <a href="Athlone%20Town%20A.F.C.">Athlone Town</a>, <a href="Glenavon%20F.C.">Glenavon</a>, <a href="Shamrock%20Rovers%20F.C.">Shamrock Rovers</a>, <a href="Shelbourne%20F.C.">Shelbourne</a> and <a href="Drogheda%20United%20F.C.">Drogheda United</a>. He scored on his Glenavon debut in February 2003.
While at Rovers he scored in European competition when Odra Wodzislaw were beaten in the <a href="UEFA%20Intertoto%20Cup">UEFA Intertoto Cup</a> in June 2003 In total he represented Rovers 4 times in Europe.
While with Shelbourne he scored in the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> qualifiers and the Uefa Cup first round in 2004. His most famous game being when introduced as a substitute and scoring 2 goals to earn a late 2-2 come from behind draw against Lille of France at <a href="Lansdowne%20Road">Lansdowne Road</a>.
Fitzpatrick signed for St. Patrick's Athletic in July 2007. He collapsed in a pre match warm up in April 2009.
He signed again for Drogheda United in January 2010.
